Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Centre of Old City Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: Han240276
Reviews.Content: Our family of 6Adults and 1Child (09years) stayed in this beautiful hotel for 5nights from 08Apr12-13Apr12 The hotel is in ideal location very close to all the major attractions and there are lot of restaurants nearby,2 tram stations are nearby Sirkeci and Gulhane which connect to the rest of Istanbul, rooms are very clean and spacious ,breakfast is excellent ,staff are good , helpful , informative especially I would like to mention 2names Ms Cilem and Mr Necad who were really outstanding and really went out of their way to make our stay as comfortable as possible. I would highly recommend this hotel to everybody and would definitely go back and stay in this hotel when I visit Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “in th middle of history”
Reviews.Author: Dina S
Reviews.Content: if you wonna good and rather cheep trip - this hotel is a good choice in the middle of historical IIstanbul.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: samargatha
Reviews.Content: A great little hotel in a central location, right in heart of the tourist sites. You can walk a couple of block away to the T1 tram which connects to the M1 metro which takes you to Ataturk International Airport, or you can ask the hotel to book an airport shuttle at a reasonable price. Staff is friendly and courteous, and there's a computer for free web surfing. Included breakfast is not great, but ok considering the great room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Gerard De Ridefort”
Reviews.Author: Jack De M
Reviews.Content: We had to stay at asur hotel for 4 days ( 3 nights ) from the 8th till the 11th of march 2012. A friendly hotel, that we recommend for each one willing to visit all the well known museums and sites. The staff are very helpful, smiling and ready to assist you with every question you have. The rooms are clean and wide enough for a couple of 2. The bathroom is also clean and equipped with the needed requirements. The breakfast is so good and tasty. We only found one prob, the rooms are over heated, thus we suggest that you choose the room with the window looking on Ibin Kamal street.The location is outstanding, in closed road filled with so good restaurants for a night walk. You just need to walk straight and left and upwards for 2 min and there you are in topkapi, blew mosque hagia sophia, cistern basilica (recommended).Many thx to Soren, for all his help and all the staff. Hotel asur you are great.

Reviews.Title: “very happy to stay in asur hotel”
Reviews.Author: tamer4444
Reviews.Content: its really my pleasure to stay in asur hotel , all the staff in the hotel do the best to let the customers happy and rest specialy mr umut and iam sure i will be best friend with him and also the lovely ayse she is very beautiful and have nice and amazing smile and mr necati and mr soner really iam feeling that asur hotel is my home in turkey with my best regards to all the staff in that hotel tamer saed egypt

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: angelaMiddlesex
Reviews.Content: What an excellent location!!!! All the attractions are walk-able. Just come back from a weeks stay at the Asur Hotel. The rooms were spacious and cleaned daily with fresh towels. Staff very friendly, free wi fi, great breakfast and safe deposit boxes in reception. My only concern is the high step up into the shower-- not great for anyone with a mobility problem. Overall excellent value for money and i look forward to returning next year.

Reviews.Title: “I work at Misr Tourism crown in large customers go to Istanbul and always sent them to this hotel after their return and”
Reviews.Author: Ibrahim E
Reviews.Content: I work at Misr Tourism crown in large customers go to Istanbul and always sent them to this hotel after their return and give thanks me because Alphenq nearby and excellent breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Good, comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: islandlover39
Reviews.Content: We stayed here only a couple of nights as part of a tour group. It was perfect for what we were after - cheap and cheerful. The rooms were clean, comfortable and the hotel itself was in a perfect location. We walked pretty much everywhere and when we couldn't be bothered the trams were not far away at all. The reception staff were very helpful and were able to provide us with simple, clear directions and help where it was needed. Breakfast was nothing to rave about, but it was adequate. What I really enjoyed about this place was the location, only ten minutes to the main sites and restaurants literally across the road and others very nearby meant that finding food was never an onerous task.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Asur, Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Michael W
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Asur is very well located...just a 10 minute walk from the Topkapi Palace, Ayasofia and the Blue Mosque. It's a small hotel but on five floors. The room was fine, not over large but clean and a good en suite bathroom. The staff were very pleasant and helpful and English was spoken at the reception. Any advice was well responded to. Beers were sold at a reasonable price too!! Breakfasts were good and there was a wide range of foods and unlimited also. Very much recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel; ideally located!”
Reviews.Author: bdebuijzer
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel, clean and comfortable rooms, perfectly located. Price quality level: super! Very friendly and helpful people at the reception desk. Thanks for being your guests!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Firorona
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very good location, rooms are clean, but the breakfast is repeated with the same items every day, but still OK since the hotel is safe, clean and in a nice location

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: andychem18
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Asur is in a wonderful location just a few minutes walk from all the attractions of the old part of Istanbul. We arrived at the hotel at about 08:00 and were in our room by 10:00 after having breakfast and a quick walk around the block. We were given the large deluxe silver room, which even had a balcony to sit out on. The staff were always helpful and the breakfast was always lovely. The hot breakfast dish changed every day and the bread and cakes were always fresh and tasty. The sour cherry drink was one of the most interesting tastes I came across during my trip if only I could find it in the UK.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, nice, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: wombatWarsaw
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel very much. Located in the center of old town, big room, with so comfortable bed that I slept instead of going out in the evening, what a shame :) Great big breakfast with variety of food. Nice staff and beautiful view on river. I definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “It was nice staying at Asur”
Reviews.Author: shamim_uae
Reviews.Content: Asur is a nice place to stay because of the good location. It is close to the market, the bus station, and money exchangers. There are plenty of restuarants just outside the hotel. The rooms are not very big but they are clean. The toilet was a bit dirty but then thats bearable.. The only funny thing was the bath tub, each time I needed to have a shower I had to take help to climb into the tub since the tub walls are a bit high. The breakfast was the most enjoyable. The staff was very good. I would like to return to Asur. One tip please learn a few important turkish words, makes life a little easy for you and the staff there.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it, this place will always be my first choice in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: HanaJalali
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located within 10 minutes walking distance to the Eminonu tram station & the train station, walk further ahead and you have access to the ferry boats station. I loved this part the most as it is so accessible. A little walk ahead from the tram station in the opposite side of the port and you have access to a large market area, very good for last minute souvenir / sweet shopping. It is very close to all the major attractions in Old Istanbul. The hotel itself is very nice, with clean rooms and bed linens. The room service is very good and the staff very helpful and friendly. The highight of the hotel to me was the extravagant breakfast buffet served every morning. Apart from this the sport the hotel is in makes it very cozy and comfortable. Step outside & you a vast option of restaurants to choose from. Access to grocery / laundry / ATMs is all within walking distances. In short I miss my stay and would love to go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good English speaking staff, huge breakfasts, great value for money”
Reviews.Author: kevyt
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we've stayed here The staff are excellent, both day and night... and they all speak very good English. The Breakfast buffet is huge and very good quality and selection. The Hotel is really well located and close to attractions and transportation. The rooms are clean. There are plenty of restaurants and bars on the doorstep of this hotel but they are for tourists and you'll need to hunt for a local experience. I would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Good location, correct room, but noisy environment”
Reviews.Author: aqwzsxedc
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a cool area, near Sirkeci (tram station and boats port), and the blue mosque. Staff is average. Room was simple (look at pictures posted by other visitors). Our room (412) was located in front on the street side. The problem is that there is a restaurant / bar just in front of the hotel, with a rooftop (and music!). Moreover we had a very noisy family just next door, with poor sound isolation. So overall, thin walls + bar in front of the window = noise! We had two twin beds, instead of the requested king size bed. The hotel provides airport transportation, with a bus. They announce a 7â‚¬ price per person, but you can ask for this to be reduced at 5â‚¬ as this is the price offered by the very same service (and bus) by an other shop around.

Reviews.Title: “Just Great!!!”
Reviews.Author: stavros01
Reviews.Content: Everything was great in this hotel. Asur is in the most convenient place in Istanbul, just 5 minutes walk from everything.Staff very proffesional and extremely kind.I stayed there 5 days with my sister and I felt like at home.Very very cheap, clean and tidy rooms,the staff had good comand of the english language, great variety in breakast, perfect view from our room at sixth floor.All these things with 45 euro per night for both of us. The first thing I did after I came back home was to write this review.Tottaly recommended.The best value for money ever! And let me repeat it, all of the people working there are unbelievable...

Reviews.Title: “Good value, near main touristic attractions”
Reviews.Author: Adrian B
Reviews.Content: Just 5 minutes walk from Topkapi, the hotel has small but clean rooms. Breakfast was included and the food was good and pretty various for a morning meal. The staff was very friendly and always helpful. The only thing is that it doesn't have a parking lot, but they're a few nearby. Expect to pay 20-30 TL (10-15 EUR) per day for parking. If you stay several days try to bargain for 20-30% off. Overall, definitely a good option for a cityscape.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks to Umut, Mohamet, and Aysha”
Reviews.Author: JomanJ
Reviews.Content: i really want to thank the professional staff escpically UMUT, Mohamet, and Ay$a they were very helpful and frindly from the moment we checked in till the moment we checked out rooms were good, clean, comfortable. breakfast was nice and varied location was great ,i spent three wonderful nights in your hotel with my family and friends and recommend it to all my friends and looking for word to seeing you again soon... Many thanks again to Umut , Mohamet. and Aysha :)

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and money for value”
Reviews.Author: DQ11
Reviews.Content: My 3 days stay in Asur Hotel in Istanbul has been excellent. Friendly staff from receptionists to kitchen helpler to bell boy. The room is clean and the old photos on the hotel website do not do them any justice as they are actually nicer and more comfortable. They need to update the room and the lobby photos. There is a plasma TV screen in the room which has more than 100 TV channels to watch. wifi was working perfectly on each level of the hotel as well as the lobby. The breakfast was fantastic with great variety of food to choose from cereals to fruits to cakes and many more choices and slight variation everyday. The location was excellent to walk around the old town of Istanbul and easy to find. On the negative side, there is no TV channels guide on English TV channels and the central heating in the room was abit too hot during my stay. But that can be overcome by turning on the fan high (was labelled as heater on the wall) which can be abit loud. My room window was facing a wall to another buidling, it provides quietness to my room but it was too close to the hotel lift on my level. Every morning when people are using the lift, I could hear them talking and provide some unwanted noise from the door. Otherwise it would be a perfect stay in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent break”
Reviews.Author: Pauline082
Reviews.Content: This was booked as a cheaper option to visit Istanbul. We were delighted with the hotel the room was clean and, at this time of year, warm. Our room was cleaned every day and we had fresh towels every day too. The hotel was clean and the staff were helpful. Breakfast was plentiful and tasty. Location was ideal being right in the centre of the old city and within walking distance of most of the sights we wanted to visit. We would have no hesitation in booking a return visit

Reviews.Title: “Great base in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Diddi21
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly and helpful and check in was a breeze. The location was great as it is located near the tram and restaurants (although touristy). Mini markets, bakeries, money changers, travel agencies and souvenir shop are all nearby. Breakfast was decent and plentiful. It could be a bit noisy at night as there are restaurants all along the street and you might be able to hear your neighbors, but I'm not a light sleeper and all the exploring in Istanbul knocked me out once my head touched the pillow! The beds were comfy and clean. I was surprised but definitely pleased as I didn't expect the rooms to be that nice and clean! I liked how they had some art hanging on the wall in the room. Made the room look nicer. There could be a problem for some to get in the bathtub for those who aren't as small and nimble as me as it was sort of raised. Other than that, I have to say the hotel it is a great base to explore Istanbul. We booked the hotel through Turkey TPS and they came through for us. Their driver was waiting for us at the airport and was very kind and helpful. Without him, I think we would've taken more time finding the hotel as cars can't go through the street the hotel is located (pedestrian road), so we had to do a bit of walking. It was fun though! (Just be sure to travel light :p) I would recommend this hotel to those who aren't fussy and just want a nice, clean place to sleep in and serves breakfast and has good free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “3 STARS +”
Reviews.Author: CodinS
Reviews.Content: A very good hotel: in the best place you could imagine for Istanbul, clean, with very friendly staff, speaking English, and a very good price! The included breakfast was good, with diverse food, as much as you can eat, even more. Thank you, to all the staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great fun”
Reviews.Author: SjLondon29
Reviews.Content: Came to Istanbul for 4 day's in late November early December we was a group off 6 women and all off our first time too Istanbul so didn't really know what too expect but we all enjoyed every minute off it and will be coming back to Istanbul soon! We arrived about 7.30pm on the Saturday night to a very busy airport we boarded our shuttle and got stuck in very bad traffic on the bridge we was in the bus for over 3 hour's so we had a bad start to the holiday, when we finally arrived in Sirkeci we walked up our small cobbled street to the Asur hotel which is the 2nd hotel on the left side off the street we was greeted by 2 young boy's on reception and shown our room's we had 2 triple room's which were quiet large with flat screen t.v's a bath (Which i have never had in a hotel in Turkey before) a 3 single bed's. We had breakfast in the hotel every morning which was a typical turkish breakfast of boiled egg's ham chesse bread honey jam and ceral all was very fresh, Their was hot coffee, tea and orange juice aswell. Hotel was situated in a great place just 5 mintue walk from main train station, tram stop on next road and very close to grand bazzar, blue mosque and hagia sophia plenty off restaurant's to choice from down the street i would recommend Salute pub for a great night out, On the Sunday we was taking on a tour off the Asian side of Istanbul and to the Bospurus for a river cruise which i will highly recommend, Bazzar was very large and sweaty inside but you will pick up plenty of bargain's and just an experince going in there really. I think 4 day's was just enough for us to see what Istanbul was all about we was all kinda turned off the idea of going to Istanbul as we was a group of 6 women 3 oldes ( 62,50,49) and us 3 youngens ( 20, 20,17) and was told it was unsafe for women to be there alone but we found this not true and all felt extremely safe walking around Istanbul at what ever time of the day/night, I have been coming too Turkey for over 6 years now and Istanbul really goes to the top of the list of favourite place's i have never seen a place like it before.

Reviews.Title: “glad to stay”
Reviews.Author: wwwriter
Reviews.Content: from the first moment i called the hotel i found the staff friendly, relaxed, happy to help and flexible. on arriving early, a room was made available. rooms were good, clean, comfortable. breakfast was nice and varied.

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: chargers22
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights recently. I would describe it as decent. Room was very small but functional. Bathroom was also small and shower was very uncomfortable. Location was terrific with lots of nice restaurants in the area and a 10 minute walk to most sites in the area. The service from the front desk was very good and polite. The breakfast was good. The biggest complaint I would have was the shuttle to the airport. We asked the front desk for a shuttle rather than a taxi due to the early morning departure and the hotel charged 80 TL. A taxi would have been about 30 to 35 TL. But overall it was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel wÄ±th great hospÄ±tality and helpful staff. A Place to vÄ±sÄ±t.”
Reviews.Author: abdulLondon
Reviews.Content: Ä°f you want to vÄ±sÄ±t and explore the TurkÄ±sh hÄ±story hotel Asur provides you wÄ±th great locatÄ±on to see local attractÄ±ons and historical places to vÄ±sÄ±t. The staff at hotel Asur are helpful and carÄ±ng wÄ±th your needs. Many thanks to Umut and Salih at the hotel who made our short stay pleasant wÄ±th smiles all around and an insight to TurkÄ±sh lifestyle. Hotel Asur is one of the places to vÄ±sÄ±t in quÄ±ck cÄ±ty break from london and Ä±n the world .

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelgirls3
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Asur Hotel for 3 nights. This hotel is in a very good location. Walking distance to all the major attractions. Hotel rooms (stayed in two different rooms) are a good size and very clean. Good breakfast and the best part of this hotel is the staff. I would not hesitate to stay at the Asur Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our Istanbul-trip !”
Reviews.Author: carinadogan
Reviews.Content: This hotel was simple but clean,good breakfast,tv,internet,super-perfect location and most of all sweet,nice,friendly and helpful staff !!!

Reviews.Title: “the perfect place”
Reviews.Author: muhammad_10
Reviews.Content: Asur hotel was one of the best hotels i visited . the service was really great the crew help us finding places at the big city. especially muhamad . and they did thier best to serve us . the second thing that i like about asur is the the location so its at the centre of the area , like a really cool cosy place .

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BenC_NZ
Reviews.Content: Spent a few days here, place was very clean and reasonably priced. The staff were awesome and nothing was too much trouble. Great location!

Reviews.Title: “The epitome of friendliness and helpfulness”
Reviews.Author: Garrickfromsouthafri
Reviews.Content: Great value, clean adequate accommodation, ideally situated for the tourist and all the staff are wonderful. Gonul Yavuz, the guest relations lady, could not have been more friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great staff if you think of...”
Reviews.Author: omer21
Reviews.Content: great hotel, great staff if you think of going to istanbul at least consider visiting asur otel. I really enjoyed my stay at asur otel. Of the staff especially gonul and zeki were very kind and helpful I assume the others are too but I did not get much into contact with them. The hotel is in the hart of Istanbul near to many touristic spots. Omer Germany

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel,great location and staff!”
Reviews.Author: cuckoo26
Reviews.Content: I wish to say what a fantastic time we had in Istanbul,this hotel is fantastic value for money with excellent location for all your needs,it is very clean and the staff were exceptional,especially Mehmet and Umut who were very friendly and nothing was too much trouble at any time of day or night,they went out of their way to ensure we had great time in beautiful Istanbul.They gave good advice and sorted our transfers etc,well done!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Egyptian82
Reviews.Content: I spend my honey moon in ASUR hotel, it was very nice hotel, clean and quite, helpful staff specially reception people Nagati, GÃ¶nÃ¼l, all people were very nice .The buffet breakfast was good with a large selection. The hotel is in a quiet area of the old city, and has a good location, for seeing the main sites of Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, no frills but clean”
Reviews.Author: kpshepard
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Asur for a week this spring and was very happy with this hotel. The service was excellent, the rooms were clean and spacious, and the location was wonderful. Easy walking distance to all the monuments, and if one is really lazy, the tram is a couple of blocks away. Breakfast was continental-turkish, with hot and cold choices, lots of fresh veggies, but nothing to write home about. Great prices, relaxed atmosphere

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel , Super Staff and Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Karl2866
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Asur Hotel from 27th to 31st May this year as we were in Istanbul for the F1 Grand Prix. We hired a car from the airport but found there was no parking at the Hotel as it is in a pedestrianised area but the Hotel staff pointed out a secure car park nearby which was staffed on a 24 hour basis. The parking fees ranged between 15 to 20 Turkish Lira per night which was worth paying knowing the car was being looked after. The Hotel itself is in the historical quarter of the City and most tourist attractions are literally a few minutes walk away along with access to the tramway system. The staff were extremley friendly and helpful and the managers Mehmet and Gonulyavuiz could not do enough to help. The rooms are clean , fairly modern and ideal for our purpose as we were out most of the day and only needed them literally to sleep and shower in. If you like to stop in and watch English TV forget it as there are no English spoken channels available. The breakfast in a morning was fine , cereals etc and the evening meals were really good value for money. We did the rounds of the local restaurants and most were dearer , some double the price. If you like lager the local brew is Effes which is 5 Lira a pint at the Asur , most other bars charge 8 and even 10 lira a pint so it is good value. On leaving the Hotel we were unfortunate enough to miss our flights and had to return for the night. Not a problem for the manager who greeted us with a big smile and managed to find us a room with only a 10 minute wait whilst one was cleaned. We will be attending the 2011 Istanbul Grand Prix and will certainly book rooms at this Hotel as we could not fault the value for money , the staff and the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: OxenhopeTyke
Reviews.Content: The Asur Hotel was perfectly placed in Istanbul for all the amenities. The buffet breakfast was good with a large selection, We only had a three night stay here but the staff at the Hotel could not do enough to help.

Reviews.Title: “magnificent”
Reviews.Author: amirouche40
Reviews.Content: Asur hotel is magnificent,and very modern,the rooms were clean,nice and spacious,my room was big enough for 2 people,the breakfast was good a lot of selection . breads, yougurt,cofee,tea,juice to get your day started,the hotel is in a quiet area of the old city, and has a good location,for seeing the main sites of istanbul. the young umut and gonul,spoke english are very welcoming and extremely helpful and friendley with there staff,its highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, thats all”
Reviews.Author: tanermetin
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel for the weekend, and unfortunately our stay began with an unfortunate incidence, we were shown our rooms, we put our staff, we were so exausted and immediately decided to take a nap, then suddenly our phone rang told us they already took the money from our credit card so asked me get downstairs to return the money back ok thank you for the warning but my sleep was already ruined they could return it while Iwas checking out, anyway I tried to sleep again then there was noise coming from the hall way making impossible to sleep I called the reception about it , anyway it was taken care of in awhile, after five min some guy knocked the door telling he brought the fruit basket! Well it is a very kind of them but timing was not just not right they could have brought earlier before we checked in. Apart from than this rooms are ok, big and clean enough, it does not look like in their web site. Location is just great, breakfast in the morning pretty much satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Juul
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location if you're there for sightseeing. The staff is very friendly and helpfull, and the rooms are clean and have good beds. Don't be put of when you see their website: the rooms don't look like that anymore. Breakfast is ok, and overall I would highly recommend this place if you're looking for a good place and are on a budget: excellent value!

Reviews.Title: “great position, best price/ quality offer”
Reviews.Author: alien74
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights in april 2010 and I think it's the best offer you can get there. Position is perfect, rooms are clean and the wi-fi works more than I've expected. The front-desk personnel is more than polite and helpful. The breakfast was ok- pretty much the same but you can't get better in Istanbul from my experience

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, value for money”
Reviews.Author: Laurens1980
Reviews.Content: Comfortable rooms and bath-room facilities. Clean. They were about to finish a major renovation of the place during our stay, so all rooms should be of excellent quality now. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Decent breakfast, apart from the coffee which is terrible. The location is wonderfully close to the major tourist sites: Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, Grand Bazar are all within easy walking distance. The restaurants and bars in this area, however, are all very touristy. Only stay in this area if you don't mind being approached by waiters trying to pull you into their bars/restaurants. If you visit Istanbul for the nightlife, stay in Beyoglu, at the other side of the Golden Horn.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Place to stay with superb staff”
Reviews.Author: kamim63
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. If you are looking for a place to sleep and be comfortable then this is your hotel. The hotel staff, front desk, resturant, office and even the cleaning staff were superb in meeting your needs.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst rooms I've ever stayed in - lucky we got upgraded!”
Reviews.Author: smitjz
Reviews.Content: Location - excellent - lots of restaurants and bars around the hotel, easy walk both to the tourist sights and to the beyoglu area with the bars and shops. Room - we were originally placed in a terrible room - tiny, dark, lots of things broken. The only plus point was that it was clean. After complaining we were eventually upgraded after 2 night to a Junior Suite. Whilst this was not perfect (still lots of things broken) it was a vast improvement - large and bright. Staff - Generally helpful (sorted a change of room eventually, rang a taxi for us to get to the airport, friendly porter), but not perfect - when I asked if the communal internet PC was broken, they just said "I guess so" and were not remotely interested in fixing it. Overall, given our upgrade and the fact that we only paid 48 GBP per night after a discount, this was not bad value. However, without the discount and room change it would have been our worst hotel stay ever, and I have to say the overall quality of the hotel for a 3 star was poor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: angel09
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a fantastic location, within easy walking distance to heaps of restaurants and all the major sites - blue mosque, aya sophia, topkapi palace. The room we had was tiny, definitely the smallest we had ever stayed in. The bathroom door was broken and wouldnt close properly and the room looked like it had air conditioning but it didnt work. Even though the weather outside wasnt very hot the room got very hot at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MsImpartial
Reviews.Content: The Asur was in a great location, near to the tram and the ferry and walking distance to the Blue Mosque and St Sophia etc. The breakfast were very basic and were the same everyday. The twin bedroom my friend and I stayed in were also basic with a wardrobe, a desk and chair and a very old and near broken fridge but that was ok because we didn't need to use the fridge (Pls beware that you may be asked to pay for the mini bar if they found something missing in the fridge because we were). The bathroom was a sore point though because its old and unclean and we had to use it everyday however the shower was quite powerful. The clean towels that were given to us had a strange smell to it, like damp and unwashed. Having said all this, I wouldn't really complaint because at the end of the day you got what you paid for. I would go back there again just to save a few quids to be in the central area of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: firefly_trip
Reviews.Content: i was staying at asur in 08/01/09-11/01/09. the hotel has realy great location - 2 minutes to serkeci station, 3 to eminonu and galata bridge, 5 minutes to sultanamet district. its very easy to get anywhere just following the tram tracks. i liked the place for its location and quitness, but there was a couple of problematic points.first - if you are looking for hotel to spend there more time then sleeping at night - thats not the place. breakfast is very basic, the bar is empty. at the prospect i"ve found in my room and at hotelasur.com they say that up stairs there is The Terrace Restaurant with nice view over the city, but on reception i was told there is no such thing. another problematic point was the bathroom - unclean and broken - i'm posting the fotos to show what i'm talking about. still after all i would probably come back to asur - this location cost much more then i've paid for asur and i dont spend much time at hotel. but those who does should think twice before the reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but reception helpfulness needs work”
Reviews.Author: Goneway
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little tricky to find as its situated in a small street that doesn't even show on most maps, so I was glad I used the airport shuttle from Sabiha Gocken. Location wise, its right near a tram stop and if you are terrible with maps, walking uphill following the tram tracks will take you right to the heart of the Sultanahmet area where the main Old Town attractions lie, like the mosque/palace/hippodrome/cistern etc. If you followed the tram tracks downhill, it will take you down to the Sirkeci train station and the river. Rooms were on the small side and quite dark but it was clean and adequate if you didn't spend all day indoors. Breakfast was ok but don't pay extra if it wasn't included in your quoted price = standard breads and drinks. Tea was a little like stew... Main gripe is the reception clerk. I asked for directions to a particular restuarant in Eminonou. He snorted and looked at me (single female) and said you don't want to go there, it's very expensive and you should only go if you are taking your boyfriend or husband there?! I couldn't believe how condescending he was?! Not going anywhere with that enquiry, I asked whether he could make any suggestions for dinner around the hotel. He shrugged and said he didn't know as he didn't eat anywhere but at the hotel as it was free. I know this is not a 5* hotel but really is it too much to ask for some basic recommendations?

Reviews.Title: “woderful location”
Reviews.Author: ashleytivon
Reviews.Content: we spent a weekend at the asur and were very satisfied. the hotel is clean and the room quiet and spacious. breakfast was not so good but there are plenty of small cafes in the area with local food. we were afraid of the location in the old city, particulary at night, but found the area safe and welcoming at all hours. also it is easy to walk to all the sights in the old city and to the markets, which were the reason we came to istanbul. the asur is great value for its price! orit roitman tivon israel

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Asur”
Reviews.Author: Herby69
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, right beside river, stunning scenery, no high rise buildings, really peaceful. We stayed in the apartments, they were huge, very clean! Sat round the hotel pool most days, it was heaven. Plenty of shops & restaurants a short walk away. I would highly recommend this hotel/apartments.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: SesmoK
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Asur from 4-8 September. Once the taxi driver had found it we wer booked in swiftly and given our keys. The room we had was a triple although we had only booked a double. The room overlooked the street in front of the hotel. The room was extremely clean and well furnished. It also had the benefit of air conditioning. The bathroom was a decent size and had a good shower. The following morning at breakfast we had choices of a turkish breakfast, bread, some cereals and yoghurt. The breakfast menu didn't change from day to day but I found it acceptable. The hotel is within an easy stroll of the Aya Sofya, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, ferry docks and Grand Bazaar. The staff were helpful and couteous especially the dining staff who pointed us in the right direction for sights and other restaurants even when they were serving food. We paid Â£26 per night for two with bed and breakfast. For that price I don't think you can go far wrong with the Asur.

HotelInfo.Name: Asur Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Hoca Pasa Mah Ibni Kemal Cd 34, Istanbul 34420, Turkey
